commit_message:
Move the rabbit/rpc options to its own section

Using the DEFAULT section for rabbit configuration is deprecated, so
all rabbit related option should be moved to the oslo_messaging_rabbit
section. The example agent config still respects the
TROVE_HOST_GATEWAY option.

This change has to depend on a change in redstack that otherwise
overwrites the hard work we do here :)

Change-Id: Ic169efdb2eb453abb6c4401a082586715a84a038
Depends-On: Iec072877e9174e136b4f0c1c806d7f9b377a7f2e

deleted_lines: iniset $TROVE_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_userid $RABBIT_USERID iniset $TROVE_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_password $RABBIT_PASSWORD iniset $TROVE_TASKMANAGER_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_userid $RABBIT_USERID iniset $TROVE_TASKMANAGER_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_password $RABBIT_PASSWORD iniset $TROVE_CONDUCTOR_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_userid $RABBIT_USERID iniset $TROVE_CONDUCTOR_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_password $RABBIT_PASSWORD iniset $TROVE_GUESTAGENT_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_userid $RABBIT_USERID iniset $TROVE_GUESTAGENT_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_host $TROVE_HOST_GATEWAY iniset $TROVE_GUESTAGENT_CONF DEFAULT rabbit_password $RABBIT_PASSWORD

commit_message:
Move the rabbit/rpc options to its own section

Using the DEFAULT section for rabbit configuration is deprecated, so
all rabbit related option should be moved to the oslo_messaging_rabbit
section.

Change-Id: Iec072877e9174e136b4f0c1c806d7f9b377a7f2e

commit_message:
Set IP and port using environment variables

Using IP and PORT it is possible to override the defaults of the Gulp
webserver. process.env.IPADDR is also used as some hosting tools, like
Procfile normally used this variable instead.

Change-Id: Ie0082bfcd7457b9c376f86ffe896aed4e84d5d0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-webclient refs/changes/06/332706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: var SERVER_PORT = process.env.PORT || 8000; var SERVER_HOST = process.env.IPADDR || process.env.IP || 'localhost'; host: SERVER_HOST, port: SERVER_PORT,

commit_message:
add "needs:*" tags to the config option modules

To make it trackable which fixes the config options need, we add tag
at the beginning of the files. If the fix is done, the tag will be
removed. We discussed this on the ML with [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095538.html

Implements blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Ibcd89bc550c6f534b5fa297df74bd59eb481e921

commit_message:
Refactor update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent for agentless topology

Current update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent will accept agent object
and update segment_host_mapping according to agent object. For the
agentless topology(for example, networking ovn), there will be no l2 agent
object. The only information will be host and physical networks.

This patch refactor update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent to let agentless
topology to reuse the existing code.

Change-Id: If03e6a734a2b2df5259e7c7b5d7069dca144a005
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/322486/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_segments_with_phys_nets(context, phys_nets): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): segments = context.session.query(db.NetworkSegment).filter( db.NetworkSegment.physical_network.in_(phys_nets)) return segments segments = get_segments_with_phys_nets(context, phys_nets) current_segment_ids = { segment['id'] for segment in segments if check_segment_for_agent(segment, agent)} update_segment_host_mapping(context, host, current_segment_ids)

commit_message:
Move gate-storyboard-js-integration to experimental

Currently this job fails and noone is available to fix it.
This patch removes its non-voting rule as well as moves it to the
experimental queue for storyboard and storyboard-webclient.

Change-Id: Ie672634b10378ff15a77cbe0d9fa91d9112cb7a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/04/333604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: experimental: - gate-storyboard-js-integration experimental: - gate-storyboard-js-integration
deleted_lines: - name: gate-storyboard-js-integration voting: false - gate-storyboard-js-integration - gate-storyboard-js-integration

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 00:04:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a8dccbcbb2b74c8378a51cab65461f8d2685363d', 'message': "Change USED_IPS variable to a Python set

USED_IPS being a list did not convey it's intention of limiting IP
addresses to only one instance. Using the set data type does this, and
removes the need for iterating over the USED_IP array from our own code.

Other lists within the code that use the 'append_if' function were not
changed here because the set datatype does not get written as a list in
YAML, which may be undesirable. It may be completely possible to cast
sets as lists on output, but this patch is largely about clarifying
intent around USED_IPS so the set-to-list dump logic wasn't explored.

Also, the duplicate IP tests were left in place due to the fact that the
IP addresses are populated into a queue structure separately, which may
still have bugs that don't belong to Python or netaddr. In the future,
it may be desirable to modify the IP-handling logic to completely use

commit_message:
Change USED_IPS variable to a Python set

USED_IPS being a list did not convey it's intention of limiting IP
addresses to only one instance. Using the set data type does this, and
removes the need for iterating over the USED_IP array from our own code.

Other lists within the code that use the 'append_if' function were not
changed here because the set datatype does not get written as a list in
YAML, which may be undesirable. It may be completely possible to cast
sets as lists on output, but this patch is largely about clarifying
intent around USED_IPS so the set-to-list dump logic wasn't explored.

Also, the duplicate IP tests were left in place due to the fact that the
IP addresses are populated into a queue structure separately, which may
still have bugs that don't belong to Python or netaddr. In the future,
it may be desirable to modify the IP-handling logic to completely use
netaddr's specialized classes.

Change-Id: I22312321738d1f1001984d4c81f7fd24b7a1f1c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/88/332588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: di.USED_IPS = set() di.USED_IPS = set()

commit_message:
Make host as second arg in compute api calls

It's better to have similar signature for consistency and
availability to apply decorator (for feature about applying cell context).

Changes modify signature for methods in compute rpcapi.

Change-Id: Iaf404ee17944ca4d0de901d5cd7109cbcab68bb4

commit_message:
Volume pagination with specific tenant

Testing the ability to filter a list of volumes
according to specific tenant.
Note: The test uses admin user, because only admin has the privileges
to perform this action, by default.

Change-Id: I761427a352ba77b7e903f121df7c49b4b9f23592
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/48/318048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: credentials = ['primary', 'admin'] cls.adm_client = cls.os_adm.volumes_client @test.idempotent_id('5866286f-3290-4cfd-a414-088aa6cdc469') def test_volume_list_param_tenant(self): # Test to list volumes from single tenant params = {'all_tenants': 1, 'project_id': self.client.tenant_id} # Getting volume list with admin credentials fetched_list = self.adm_client.list_volumes(params=params)['volumes'] self.assertVolumesIn(fetched_list, self.volume_list, fields=('id',))

commit_message:
Improved table deletion efficiency

Volumes and instances integration tests deleted and validated entities
one row at a time, now they are able to delete and validate multiple
rows at a time.

Change-Id: I7f8fdc7e0ccefdd0f6d71f9f92c8a2aefeec8d54
Closes-bug: #1585209
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/82/322282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_all_volumes(self): select_all_checkbox = self._get_element( By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.themable-checkbox') select_all_checkbox.click() confirm_delete_volumes_form = self.volumes_table.delete_volume() confirm_delete_volumes_form.submit()

subject: Subscription confirmation support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 06:44:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs/commit/075204d35421a68db49e58495e56bcc1b9deacc5', 'message': "Confirm subscriber befor send messages

Currently Zaqar can post messages to the subscriber
once the subscription is created.
It doesn't need the subscriber to confirm the subscription.

This will lead a problem that users could send junk
information that whether subscriber want or not.

So we should support to confirm subscription by using
HTTP POST request like what Amazon SNS is doing.

Change-Id: I43c202e86a7a6a9605747096f707104d2d699010

commit_message:
Subscription confirmation support

Currently Zaqar can post notifications to the subscriber
once the subscription is created.
It doesn't need the subscriber to confirm the subscription.

This will lead a problem that users could send junk
information that whether subscriber want or not.

So we should support to confirm subscription by using
HTTP request like what Amazon SNS is doing.

Change-Id: I43c202e86a7a6a9605747096f707104d2d699010
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs refs/changes/55/284555/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================================================ Support for confirming subscriber before zaqar send message ============================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/confirm-the-subscription-before-send-message Support subscribers confirm that whether they want the messages or not before zaqar sends them. Problem description =================== Currently Zaqar can post messages to the subscriber once the subscription is created. It doesn't need the subscriber to confirm the subscription. This will lead a problem that users could send junk information that whether subscriber want or not. Proposed change =============== With Amazon SNS[1] as reference, we will support to send HTTP POST request that contains subscription confirmation information(e.g. message, subscribe URL, token) to subscription endpoint. The endpoint need to use the subscribe URL in message to confirm subscription. So the workflow will be this: User create subscribe in Zaqar ---> Zaqar send a HTTP POST request with subscription confirmation information ---> Subscriber confirm this subscription by sending request Zaqar server using subscribe URL ---> Zaqar return a response and confirm successfully ---> Zaqar begin to send messages to this endpoint. Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- A new resource Confirmation will be added in Zaqar like this: { 'confirmation_id': uuid, 'subscription_id': uuid, 'timestamp': date, 'is_confirm': boolean, } REST API impact --------------- Add new HTTP URL like this: POST http://127.0.0.1:8888/v2/confirmation?subscription_id?is_confirm=True Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: wangxiyuan<wangxiyuan@huawei.com> Secondary assignee: wanghao<wanghao749@huawei.com> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Mitaka-3 Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Both unit and Tempest tests need to be created to cover the code change that mentioned in "Proposed change". Documentation Impact ==================== 1. The Zaqar API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the REST API changes. References ========== [1]http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/SendMessageToHttp.html

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/commmon in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator, so don't
use this directory any more. We also removed this from
cookiecutter in I7bfb899f8b94e4dc19fd4cef43466a5baac3a3ec.

Change-Id: I3270db9dbaffccfde184d5fc17aed73359fe86dd

commit_message:
Use DummyYaqlYamlLoader to load classes during upload

This commit changes the loader, that loads MuranoPL classes during
package upload to DummyYaqlYamlLoader. This would allow importing and parsing
packages that contain '!yaql' tag without any errors, when importing to
glare.

Change-Id: I9071bb479019cac20bf61f110154082063c9d777
Closes-Bug: #1586028

commit_message:
Match ansible output for console

If you look at console.html output with the zuul/ansible launchers in
a web-browser, you get weird coloring of the lines.  For example a
line like

 2016-06-17 03:19:47.803531 INFO:zuul.Cloner:Loaded map containing 1 rules

starts everything looking "blue" (for info) after it.

The problem is that the above line looks enough like an olso line that
the oslo formatting-regex picks it up and sets the "info" status,
which persists until it happens to match another line that alters the
status.  Previously, Jenkins would prepend these lines with
"timestamp | ..."  which prevented these matches.

To avoid this problem, but not affect matching for thinks like
devstacklog, add a more specific match for the ansible timestamp
format and match on that first.  A test-case is added.

Change-Id: Icfd9ff3d8d42abc7276b2aaa4021ddb1a82c3630
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-loganalyze refs/changes/14/331514/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_ansible_filters(self): # test ansible console.html files gen = self.get_generator('console-ansible.html.gz') header = gen.next() self.assertNotIn("Display level: ", header) # We want to make sure very line is considered a date-line and # has no severity formatting (we have had issues where lines # incorrectly matched oslo-format, etc). for line in gen: if "2016-06-17" in line: self.assertIn("<span class='NONE ", line) self.assertIn("class='date'", line)

commit_message:
Fix keystone-coverage-db gate for stable/liberty

keystone-coverage-db gate is currently broken for stable/liberty
branch because it is using dogpile.cache version 0.6.1 which
breaks some tests in keystone.tests.unit.test_cache_backend_mongo
as seen here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332975/1.

We need to put an upper limit to the version of dogpile.cache to
version 0.5.7 which is the one used previously by this gate and
which was working successfully.

Change-Id: I2e2bcb76e4a20894cf8d799cd5718e9a7fc5646f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/37/333537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dogpile.cache>=0.5.4,<=0.5.7

commit_message:
/services?name=<name> API fails when using list_limit

When using list_limit configuration option in Default section of
keystone.conf, the /services?name=<service_name> API fails to find
the service if list_limit value is smaller than the total number
of services and the searched service is not among the first
'list_limit' services. The API should first filter by name and
only afterwards truncate the result list.

Also, this patch fixes setting the 'truncated' attribute of the
driver's hint.limit object when truncating the list outside of
driver_hints.truncated decorator, problem exposed by fixing the
problem described in the first paragraph.

Closes-Bug: #1594482
(cherry picked from commit 6a9a9f002f44c15d40cf890eefd03a4ab6172b0b)
Conflicts:
	keystone/common/driver_hints.py
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_catalog.py
Change-Id: I832f542c3cb0faf94a1e5bce5a894f7f4d26a8de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/75/332975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - > [`bug 1594482 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1594482>`_] When using list_limit config option, the GET /services?name={service_name} API was first truncating the list and afterwards filtering by name. The API was fixed to first filter by name and only afterwards truncate the result list to the desired limit.

commit_message:
Patch through the error from NewReplicator

Normally this is pointless, because we test NewReplicator by
itself and we know that it works. However, if anything goes
pear shaped in the environment, like swift.conf is missing,
we want to know what it is, rather than guess.

commit_message:
Add section on release notes to reviewing doc

This commit adds a brief section about ensuring release notes are
present to the reviewing doc. This should hopefully make it more
clear to reviewers when we need to include release notes.

Change-Id: I0815b9c24f6ec9e384b1657c94ed387d0d748392
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/38/332838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Release Notes ------------- Release notes are how we indicate to users and other consumers of Tempest what has changed in a given release. Since Tempest 10.0.0 we've been using `reno`_ to manage and build the release notes. There are certain types of changes that require release notes and we should not approve them without including a release note. These include but aren't limited to, any addition, deprecation or removal from the lib interface, any change to configuration options (including deprecation), CLI additions or deprecations, major feature additions, and anything backwards incompatible or would require a user to take note or do something extra. .. _reno: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

added_lines: Both of the APIs currently have two major versions, SUPPORTED v1 and CURRENT v2. It is possible to run either or both versions, by setting appropriate values of ``enable_v1_api``, ``enable_v2_api``, ``enable_v1_registry`` and ``enable_v2_registry``. If the v2 API is used, running ``glance-registry`` is optional, as v2 of ``glance-api`` can connect directly to the database. For more information, see `Using public Image API <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/glanceapi.html>`_.

commit_message:
Removing duplicate gather_facts in playbooks

This was introduced in I348a4b7dfe70d56a64899246daf65ea834a75d2a

Ansible complains with:

[WARNING]: While constructing a mapping from /opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks
/lxc-containers-create.yml, line 16, column 3, found a duplicate dict key
(gather_facts).  Using last defined value only.

Change-Id: I0cb978aa7b434568406a38c71da2e4bb1e1549cc

revert removal of create_ovs_vif_port timeout

  keyword argument form the creat_ovs_vif_port function
  caused by Ifa53e5e821093459ab7a390ff8af26028b2a9056
- This change introduces unit test to check the useage of
  the timeout arg.

commit_message:
remove support for legacy v2 generator extensions

This removes the support for legacy v2 extensions which were allowed
to be generators to have a pre / post processing phase. The modern
compute api stack never supported this construct.

Because of the remove of the 'pre' phase, the 'post_process' phase is
just renamed to 'process'.

All pre_process and generator tests are removed.

Change-Id: Ia34c1f814fb938915d74c6845dfa5135cba29d0a

self.assertEqual(called, ['pre1', 'pre2']) self.assertIsNone(response) self.assertEqual(len(post), 2) self.assertTrue(inspect.isgenerator(post[0])) self.assertTrue(inspect.isgenerator(post[1])) for gen in post: try: gen.send(None) except StopIteration: continue self.assertEqual(called, ['pre1', 'pre2', 'post2', 'post1']) def test_pre_process_extensions_generator_response(self): class extension2(req): called.append('pre2') extensions = [extension1, extension2] response, post = resource.pre_process_extensions(extensions, None, {}) self.assertEqual(called, ['pre1']) self.assertEqual(response, 'foo') self.assertEqual(post, []) def test_post_process_extensions_regular(self): class Controller(object): def index(self, req, pants=None): return pants controller = extension2(req): yield called.append(2) yield 'foo' ext1 = extension1(None) next(ext1) ext2 = extension2(None) next(ext2) response = resource.post_process_extensions([ext2, ext1], None, None, {}) commit_message:
Add Trustee User and Domain Creation

Magnum requires a specialized user and domain created
in order to own the stacks created for bays.  This patch
ensures that the trustee domain and user are created,
and that the appropriate configuration entries are placed into
magnum.conf

Change-Id: I0bb351d6cd60217d7c79cb44ca895681e01c8407

commit_message:
Destroy repo containers before upgrade

During the upgrade from Kilo to Liberty, this change deletes the
repo containers and recreates them to fix an issue with dependencies.

Change-Id: Iec9e306b41d39c09a6ef440861370d113e3cb3e5
Closes-bug: 1577799
Closes-bug: 1585243

subject: Support JSON data for port binding profile
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:22:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/f716863fc2fac319e3327dcd58a79863fbfeb8b7', 'message': 'Support JSON data for port binding profile

Update the "--binding-profile" option on the "port create" and
"port set" commands to support both <key>=<value> and JSON input
for the port custom binding profile data. The JSON input is
sometimes needed to maintain the value type (e.g. integer) for
more advanced data.

The port custom binding profile data is unique across neutron
so a custom argparse.Action class was created instead of
writting a generic class in osc-lib.

Change-Id: I82ac6d4f95afdc866f5282fc00d390f850f54d21
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

for the port custom binding profile data. The JSON input is
sometimes needed to maintain the value type (e.g. integer) for
more advanced data.

The port custom binding profile data is unique across neutron
so a custom argparse.Action class was created instead of
writting a generic class in osc-lib.

Change-Id: I82ac6d4f95afdc866f5282fc00d390f850f54d21
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
'}]
commit_message:
Support JSON data for port binding profile

Update the "--binding-profile" option on the "port create" and
"port set" commands to support both <key>=<value> and JSON input
for the port custom binding profile data. The JSON input is
sometimes needed to maintain the value type (e.g. integer) for
more advanced data.

The port custom binding profile data is unique across neutron
so a custom argparse.Action class was created instead of
writting a generic class in osc-lib.

Change-Id: I82ac6d4f95afdc866f5282fc00d390f850f54d21
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/19/331119/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add pep8 checks to unit tests

Let's make sure the unit tests also follow the same pep8 guidelines.

Also fixed any current pep8 errors and renamed test_ut_datagen to
test_datagen for consistency.

commit_message:
Fix job and data sources time values

This patch fixes Job Execution and Data Sources time values for the
Job Execution and Data Sources details views. Now they are shown with
time according to timezone which set in settings.
Also imported 'filters' module from horizon.utils as a workaround for
proper compressing (see bug 1551009)

Change-Id: I5c0173b431919348e3f0a0aa9cbdc5bc943acd60
partial-bug: 1563419
closes-bug: 1551009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/30/299230/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pytz import timezone as tzfrom django.utils import timezone from oslo_utils import timeutilsdef _to_time_zone(datetime_str): fmt = '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S' zone = tz(timezone.get_current_timezone_name()) dt_utc = timezone.utc.localize(timeutils.parse_strtime(datetime_str, fmt)) dt_zone = dt_utc.astimezone(zone) return dt_zone.strftime(fmt) def _job_time_to_tz(job): if job.start_time: job.start_time = _to_time_zone(job.start_time) if job.end_time: job.end_time = _to_time_zone(job.end_time) if job.created_at: job.created_at = _to_time_zone(job.created_at) if job.updated_at: job.updated_at = _to_time_zone(job.updated_at) _job_time_to_tz(jex)

commit_message:
Fix time values of cluster provision steps

This patch fixes time values of cluster provision steps according to
timezone in dashboard settings.

Change-Id: Ibe5574b5577f4d792dd2829662881c4d90c44436
closes-bug: 1563419
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/97/301597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pytz import timezone as ptz import six from django.template import defaultfilters as filters from django.utils import timezone :param end_time: (optional) End timestamp. def to_time_zone(self, datetime, tzone, input_fmt=None, localize=False): """Changes given datetime string into given timezone :param datetime: datetime string :param tzone: timezone as a string (e.g. "Europe/Paris") :param input_fmt: (optional) format of datetime param, if None then the default Sahara API format (%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S) will be used :param localize: (optional) if True then format of datetime will be localized according to current timezone else it will be in the default Sahara API format (%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S) :return datetime string in the current django timezone """ default_fmt = '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S' if input_fmt is None: input_fmt = default_fmt dt_in_utc = timezone.utc.localize( timeutils.parse_strtime(datetime, input_fmt)) dt_in_zone = dt_in_utc.astimezone(ptz(tzone)) if localize: return filters.date(dt_in_zone, "DATETIME_FORMAT") else: return dt_in_zone.strftime(default_fmt)
deleted_lines: import six :param end_time: End timestamp. Optional.

commit_message:
Use correct conf group for SSL options

The SSL options don't use the DEFAULT group anymore, but instead use
wsgi. This corrects that.

Change-Id: I14908ca9c22368415d6ae46e30f3662b0a663a0f

commit_message:
hadoop-swiftfs: Allow configuring container.tenant

Implements the possibility to manipulate the storage URL
to specify the AUTH_tenant, when accessing containers
that are shared across different tenants

https://swiftstack.com/docs/cookbooks/swift_usage/auth.html

Sample config snippet:

<property>
  <name>fs.swift.service.sahara.auth.endpoint.prefix</name>
  <value>/v1/AUTH_</value>
</property>
<property>

  <value>uuid</value>
</property>

commit_message:
hadoop-swiftfs: SimpleDateFormat is locale specific

Parse Last-Modified with US locale.
I got an Unparseable date exception when running under Swedish locale.

Add FakeObject classes to fakes.py, update unit tests in identity V2.

Clean up fakes.py , use FakeCatalog, FakeProject, FakeService,
FakeEndpoint, FakeRole classes instead, also update their unit tests.

commit_message:
Improve masking of secrets in configuration show

The command "configuration show" tries to redact some of the secrets
that are shown on the screen. However, this failed redacting options
that were marked as secrete by the auth plugins (if any) and it redacted
other options that were not redacted at all. For example, when using
the OpenID Connect plugins, it redacted the "access_token_endpoint" as
the word "token" appears there, but it failed to redact "client_secret"
even when this option is marked as secret in the corresponding plugin.

Change-Id: Idfad4fbbe5ddcff5e729e1dcd756d0379ad31dee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/10/331610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneauth1.loading import baseREDACTED_ITEMS = ["password", "token"] auth_plugin_name = self.app.client_manager.auth_plugin_name secret_opts = [] opts = [] for o in base.get_plugin_options(auth_plugin_name): if o.secret: secret_opts.append(o.dest) else: opts.append(o.dest) # NOTE(aloga): if we have a exact match and the option is not # marked as secrete, prefer this over redacting it (we can have # options like "token_endpoint") if key.lower() in opts: pass elif (key.lower() in secret_opts or any([i in key.lower() for i in REDACTED_ITEMS])):
deleted_lines: if 'password' in key.lower(): value = REDACTED if 'token' in key.lower():

A new flavor with not enough disk to install the

commit_message:
Add another 'fault' flavor

Apparently there are two code paths for a failure
creating a Nova instance. One returns immediatesly
and the other takes some time to fail.  The case
where the initial command to Nova succeeds only
to fail later needs another flavor to test it.

A new flavor with not enough disk to install the
Trove image has been created to test this scenarion.

Change-Id: I5d3339e9cbfd6aeb0c3ff6936fefa8dbe9e841f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/66/316566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This will allow Nova to create an instance, but not enough disk to boot the image add_flavor 'fault_1' 30 512 1 1 # This should be enough memory to cause Nova to fail entirely due to too much allocation add_flavor 'fault_2' 31 131072 5 1
deleted_lines: # This should be big enough to cause Nova to fail allocation add_flavor 'fault' 35 131072 5 1

Fixes for inventory file creation

The current method for inventory file creation creates inconsistent
host entries (user and key differ) these fixes create
a consistent and reusable inventory file

commit_message:
Explicit Teardown

- added --teardown arg to quickstart.sh
  - all to teardown all
  - virthost to teardown host setup and nodes
  - nodes to teardown only nodes
- split plays and added teardown tags

Change-Id: I47ee4e2af8529126462084af9591bc34f84bf038
Close-Bug: #1570289

added_lines: echo " --teardown" --teardown|-d) OPT_TEARDOWN=$2 shift ;; set -x if [ "$OPT_TEARDOWN" = "local" ]; then TEARDOWN_SKIP_TAGS="" elif [ "$OPT_TEARDOWN" = "virthost" ]; then TEARDOWN_SKIP_TAGS="teardown-all" elif [ "$OPT_TEARDOWN" = "nodes" ]; then TEARDOWN_SKIP_TAGS="teardown-all,teardown-libvirt" fi OPT_SKIP_TAGS="${TEARDOWN_SKIP_TAGS-"teardown-all,teardown-libvirt,teardown-domains"}${OPT_SKIP_TAGS:+$OPT_SKIP_TAGS,}"

commit_message:
Improve server functional tests

Patch set [1] fixed timing issues related to the server functional
tests. As part of the review, additional enhancements were
suggested. This patch set provides those enhancements. In particular,
the functional tests will now check for the cirros256 flavor and
the cirros-*-uec image.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313870/

Change-Id: I7fe18e26b3d09db92bbe669ffafcd16618cae383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/54/333354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rtheis): Get cirros256 or m1.tiny flavors since functional # tests may create other flavors. flavors = cls.openstack('flavor list -c Name -f value').split('\n') server_flavor = None for flavor in flavors: if flavor in ['m1.tiny', 'cirros256']: server_flavor = flavor break return server_flavor # NOTE(rtheis): Get cirros image since functional tests may # create other images. images = cls.openstack('image list -c Name -f value').split('\n') server_image = None for image in images: if image.startswith('cirros-') and image.endswith('-uec'): server_image = image break return server_image
deleted_lines: # NOTE(rtheis): Get m1.tiny flavor since functional tests may # create other flavors. raw_output = cls.openstack('flavor show m1.tiny -c id -f value') return raw_output.strip('\n') # NOTE(rtheis): Get public images since functional tests may # create private images. raw_output = cls.openstack('image list --public -f value -c ID') ray = raw_output.split('\n') idx = int(len(ray) / 2) return ray[idx]

commit_message:
use env vars to specify OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION

If the default identity API version were to change
in devstack, the v2.0 tests would fail today,
resulting in a broken OSC gate.

Change-Id: Id634ea7e0fab9f3772383b5512ccac19f5119ac0

commit_message:
support multi-delete for volume-type

Added the ability to delete multiple volume types at once. Note
there are no unit tests exist for v1 volume-types, so instead
a functional test was created.

Partial-Bug: #1592906
Change-Id: I99f3f22901ab35252b91a3072b14de7d19cb17ca

commit_message:
Enhance Heat Orchestration Over Glance Metadata

Extend Heat's capabilities over arbitrary properties applied to
Glance images.

Change-Id: I5ae461507fbd72e4e84b7ec641d1f9b0d2cd707f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/42/313642/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Enhance Heat Orchestration Over Glance Metadata ================================================ `bp glance-heat-metadata-enhancements <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/glance-heat-metadata-enhancements>_` This extends Heat's orchestration abilities to include arbitrary user-defined key/value pairs. This blueprint can be viewed as an extension of blueprint `heat-glance-image-tag-support <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/heat-glance-image-tag-support>_`. Problem description =================== While Heat currently orchestrates many Glance image properties, its support is incomplete. In particular, Heat does not natively support the following metadata: * Operating system architecture * Operating system distribution * Operating system version * Instance UUID * Kernel ID * Ramdisk ID Furthermore, HOT authors cannot orchestrate images with other key/value pairs that might be used in the development and implementation of experimental or vendor-specific features. Proposed change =============== Modify OS::Glance::Image to allow for user-defined key/values. Alternatives ------------ Users wishing to apply currently unsupported metadata would need to do it after the stack has been deployed. Implementation ============== Within heat/engine/resources/openstack/glance/image.py, both the PROPERTIES and properties_schema variables would need to be modified to support the additional Glance metadata. Particularly, user-defined key/values would be implemented as a properties schema map. The handle_create() method would also be extended to apply the metadata with any user defined values. A handle_update() method will also be implemented to add and remove tags from existing resources rather than recreating them. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jaime Guerrero, <jg3755@att.com, jaimguer> Other contributors: Rusty Eddy, <ge363p@att.com> Milestones ---------- Work Items ---------- * Modify PROPERTIES variable * Modify properties_schema * Modify handle_create() * Implement handle_update() * Write tests for supported Glance and user-defined metadata Dependencies ============ This spec's implementation will be based off of `heat-glance-image-tag-support <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/heat-glance-image-tag-support>_`.

Fix the help message for 'get-mks-console'

MKS is not a serial console but the standard type of VM console for
VMware instances.

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.30

Now the os-migrateLive API supports a new body argument called 'force' which
helps the operators to bypass the scheduler call in case they provide a host.

Also modifies the host_evacuate_live helper method in the contrib tree to make
sure operators also have the force flag in case they need it for a global call.

Change-Id: Id7fcd88ad060390ac6d1a21510d84363ed643957
Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/32/332232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_live_migration_v2_30(self): self.run_command('live-migration sample-server hostname', api_version='2.30') self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/1234/action', {'os-migrateLive': {'host': 'hostname', 'block_migration': 'auto'}}) self.run_command('live-migration --force sample-server hostname', api_version='2.30') self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/1234/action', {'os-migrateLive': {'host': 'hostname', 'block_migration': 'auto', 'force': True}}) def test_host_evacuate_live_2_30(self): self.run_command('host-evacuate-live --force hyper ' '--target-host hostname', api_version='2.30') self.assert_called('GET', '/os-hypervisors/hyper/servers', pos=0) body = {'os-migrateLive': {'host': 'hostname', 'block_migration': 'auto', 'force': True}} self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid1/action', body, pos=1) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid2/action', body, pos=2) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid3/action', body, pos=3) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid4/action', body, pos=4)

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.29

Now the os-evacuate API supports a new body argument called 'force' which
helps the operators to bypass the scheduler call in case they provide a host.

Also modifies the host_evacuate helper method in the contrib tree to make sure
operators also have the force flag in case they need it for a global call.

Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

added_lines: def test_host_evacuate_v2_29(self): self.run_command('host-evacuate hyper --target target_hyper --force', api_version='2.29') self.assert_called('GET', '/os-hypervisors/hyper/servers', pos=0) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid1/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'target_hyper', 'force': True} }, pos=1) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid2/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'target_hyper', 'force': True} }, pos=2) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid3/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'target_hyper', 'force': True} }, pos=3) self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/uuid4/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'target_hyper', 'force': True} }, pos=4) def test_evacuate_v2_29(self): self.run_command('evacuate sample-server new_host', api_version="2.29") self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/1234/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'new_host'}}) self.run_command('evacuate sample-server new_host ' '--password NewAdminPass', api_version="2.29") self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/1234/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'new_host', 'adminPass': 'NewAdminPass'}}) self.run_command('evacuate --force sample-server new_host', api_version="2.29") self.assert_called('POST', '/servers/1234/action', {'evacuate': {'host': 'new_host', 'force': True}})

commit_message:
Fix v2 auth when domain args are present

This fixes two problems:
* Remove v3-only fields when v2 auth is specifically selected
* Remove the auth-type default when url and endpoint are not present

Closes-bug: #1447704
Change-Id: I82c3c8c60cf332c7fa6580a27eb3efac3b723901

commit_message:
Add a note to the README file where to report bugs

Change-Id: I6cee4c695346e0bfa3ae9ca82a78beca1c6f7e60
(cherry picked from commit 7d2964acbdba7fc7ac1bf68f044cff19603f0018)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/88/332988/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Where to report bugs? ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The openstack-ansible-security role is a part of the `OpenStack Ansible project`_. Please report bugs on `Launchpad in the openstack-ansible project`_. .. _OpenStack Ansible project: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/projects/openstackansible.html .. _Launchpad in the openstack-ansible project: https://launchpad.net/openstack-ansible

commit_message:
Don't hardcode user:group ownership after the "jenkins" name

This will prevent permissions setting from failing when run under
another user which can be expected when running in other
environments or as openstack-infra phases out jenkins.

Change-Id: Id4cf39e2d4fd21604d359eb6ce6a3716b6bba931
Depends-On: I58f6ee3ce22a3826fadfb019d3c67be710ab95d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/16/333016/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo chown -R "$(id -u).$(id -g)" $LOG_DIR

commit_message:
Added changes for lbaas testing.

Scenario001 has been updated to test lbaas v2.
Scenario002 and Scenario003 will do lbaas v1.

Change-Id: I824b3fd18bcf965875c663ce03d2a99a771f13ee
Depends-On: I69b7635984fe74038db2025b89f638def5029849

commit_message:
Allowing ip operations in fullstack test

This patch is to discuss how we allow Kuryr to operate for
the fullstack tests we are adding and require creating
containers and associating them with Kuryr networks. This
requires binding and executing ipdb operations for creating
interfaces, etc. As of now, these operations fail.

Change-Id: Ie7c435c00746a2e89c7c06435e96abaa24c6ddf4

subject: Consolidate service_providers into neutron server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-28 08:12:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/f1de70ca445c329babe0a7ca3d7e6603e0394067', 'message': 'Consolidate service_providers into neutron server

The configuration of vpnaas and lbaas services created
additional files that were never included in the service
startup. The lbaas service config provider was updated
to put service providers directly into neutron.conf
but now if we update vpnaas to do the same we will fail
being idempotent since both providers will overwrite

commit_message:
Consolidate service_providers into neutron server

The configuration of vpnaas and lbaas services created
additional files that were never included in the service
startup. The lbaas service config provider was updated
to put service providers directly into neutron.conf
but now if we update vpnaas to do the same we will fail
being idempotent since both providers will overwrite
each other. This change moves neutron_config provider from
ini_setting to openstackconfig to handle the multi-value
of service_provider and adds a variable to neutron::server
to manage service providers.

Closes-Bug: 1578912
Change-Id: I69b7635984fe74038db2025b89f638def5029849
(cherry picked from commit f77ef0ec6530686e7b6ba5adc2a5091fe07a9428)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/11/322411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should require a name' do expect { Puppet::Type.type(:neutron_config).new({}) }.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, 'Title or name must be provided') end it 'should not expect a name with whitespace' do expect { Puppet::Type.type(:neutron_config).new(:name => 'f oo') }.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, /Parameter name failed/) end it 'should fail when there is no section' do expect { Puppet::Type.type(:neutron_config).new(:name => 'foo') }.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, /Parameter name failed/) end it 'should not require a value when ensure is absent' do Puppet::Type.type(:neutron_config).new(:name => 'DEFAULT/foo', :ensure => :absent) end it 'should accept a valid value' do @neutron_config[:value] = 'bar' expect(@neutron_config[:value]).to eq(['bar']) end it 'should not accept a value with whitespace' do @neutron_config[:value] = 'b ar' expect(@neutron_config[:value]).to eq(['b ar']) end it 'should accept valid ensure values' do @neutron_config[:ensure] = :present expect(@neutron_config[:ensure]).to eq(:present) @neutron_config[:ensure] = :absent expect(@neutron_config[:ensure]).to eq(:absent) end it 'should not accept invalid ensure values' do expect { @neutron_config[:ensure] = :latest }.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, /Invalid value/) end

commit_message:
Revert "Ceilometer composable roles for controller"

We've discovered this patch never had passing CI due to a DLRN
build failure.

commit_message:
Volume manage/unmanage support for Eqlx driver

This change will allow cinder to manage existing
volumes on Dell PS Series(Equallogic) backend and also
unmanage them.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint eqlx-volume-manage-unmanage

Change-Id: I2a2f950e9ea3017d8c0bee8dbc025cf4f4a8eb99

self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeNotFound, self.driver._get_volume_info, self.volume_name) def test_manage_existing(self): ref = {'source-name': self.volume_name} with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_eql_execute') as mock_eql_execute: with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_get_volume_info') as mock_volume_info: mock_volume_info.return_value = self.fake_volume_info mock_eql_execute.return_value = self.fake_iqn_return model_update = self.driver.manage_existing(self.volume, ref) self.assertEqual(self._model_update, model_update) def test_manage_existing_invalid_ref(self): ref = {} with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_eql_execute') as mock_eql_execute: mock_eql_execute.return_value = self.fake_iqn_return self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing, self.volume, ref) def test_manage_existing_get_size(self): ref = {'source-name': self.volume_name} with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_eql_execute') as mock_eql_execute: mock_eql_execute.return_value = self.fake_volume_output size = self.driver.manage_existing_get_size(self.volume, ref) self.assertEqual(float('5.0'), size) def test_manage_existing_get_size_invalid_ref(self): """Error on manage with invalid reference.""" ref = {} self.assertRaises(exception.ManageExistingInvalidReference, self.driver.manage_existing_get_size, self.volume, ref) def test_unmanage(self): with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_eql_execute') as mock_eql_execute: mock_eql_execute.return_value = None self.driver.unmanage(self.volume)

commit_message:
Replace print statment with print function

In PY3, print should used as a function instead of a statement.
This is PY27 compatible as well.

For example, instances of the first case were replaced by the
second case:

>>> print 'help'
  File "<stdin>", line 1
    print 'help'
               ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

>>> print('help')
help

Change-Id: I247aedf4a3090c2d75338389cf383adb090da231
Closes-bug: #1594741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/59/332659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print(help % dict(project=project, venv=venv, root=root))

commit_message:
Update README to comply with Identity v3

Updated the README instructions to use Identity V3 parameters
and removed the reference to the deprecated Nova 2.0 as an auth endpoint.

Change-Id: I78bef987986c461651ba4331bc7cc7db97ce91fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/58/330758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with the ``--os-username``, ``--os-password`` and ``--os-project-name`` export OS_USERNAME=<username> export OS_PASSWORD=<password> export OS_PROJECT_NAME=<project-name> environment variables as well and set the OS_AUTH_URL to the keystone endpoint:: export OS_AUTH_URL=http://<url-to-openstack-keystone>:5000/v3/ export OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION=2.1 >>> from keystoneauth1.identity import v3 >>> from keystoneauth1 import session >>> auth = v3.Password(auth_url='http://example.com:5000/v3', ... username='username', ... password='password', ... project_name='project-name', ... user_domain_id='default', ... project_domain_id='default') >>> sess = session.Session(auth=auth) >>> nova = client.Client("2.1", session=sess) >>> nova.flavors.list() >>> nova.servers.list() >>> nova.keypairs.list()
deleted_lines: with the ``--os-username``, ``--os-password`` and ``--os-tenant-name`` export OS_USERNAME=openstack export OS_PASSWORD=yadayada export OS_TENANT_NAME=myprojectan environment variables as well:: export OS_AUTH_URL=http://example.com:8774/v2/ export OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION=2 If you are using Keystone, you need to set the OS_AUTH_URL to the keystone endpoint:: export OS_AUTH_URL=http://example.com:5000/v2.0/ >>> nt = client.Client(VERSION, USER, PASSWORD, TENANT, AUTH_URL) >>> nt.flavors.list() >>> nt.servers.list() >>> nt.keypairs.list()

commit_message:
Enable devmode with a single option

This will let us use the upstream images by just specifying
--config config/general_config/devmode.yml

Change-Id: I1cef77c19fcc330bf378dbabbaad8445fd23778b

commit_message:
New place of current-tripleo repo

current-tripleo repo file is moved to new address,
alghouth it's redirected from older it could cause problem to
non supporting redirects clients (i.e. curl)

Change-Id: I08bbf01d68579d23a8baa4fbcd3a68f69e0512fb

commit_message:
Modify "policy.conf" to "policy.json"

Because "policy.conf" does not exist in nova project, modify it
to "policy.json" instead.

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-05-10 20:42:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/4b7dd38bcf0b54d00554b97b31b20c22549721ed', 'message': 'Database changes to meet PCI-DSS change password requirements

This patch creates new password table columns in order to support
PCI-DSS change password requirements:
* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.
* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.
* The user is required to change their password if they did not create
the password, e.g. initial password was created by an admin.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: Ib515b0d8e56a74bb8eb12baa79c8bc133fa5d809

'}, {'number': 57, 'created': '2016-06-10 15:02:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/41f2d1287d8dc544a0907183a012560ebdaeaa4b', 'message': 'PCI-DSS Password table changes

This patch creates new password table columns in order to support
the PCI-DSS:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: Ib515b0d8e56a74bb8eb12baa79c8bc133fa5d809
'}, {'number': 58, 'created': '2016-06-10 16:17:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a57e4bed9c6faaf84b167f91f45a8a50b6f41701', 'message': 'PCI-DSS Password table changes

properties to allow for multiple passwords in order to support:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Password SQL model changes

This patch creates new password table columns and updates the password
properties to allow for multiple passwords in order to support:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.4: Change user passwords/passphrases at least once every
90 days.

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: Ib515b0d8e56a74bb8eb12baa79c8bc133fa5d809
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/84/314284/83 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy as sql def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = sql.MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine password_table = sql.Table('password', meta, autoload=True) created_at_column = sql.Column('created_at', sql.DateTime(), nullable=True) password_table.create_column(created_at_column) expires_at_column = sql.Column('expires_at', sql.DateTime(), nullable=True) password_table.create_column(expires_at_column)

commit_message:
Add support to both v2 and v3 auth_urls

This patch adds support to authenticate all datasource drivers
using both v2 and v3 auth_urls. Also made change in devstack
plugin to use v3 by default for authentication

TODO: keystone and swift datasource drivers to support v3

Change-Id: I6d3b8511be871cc8f571d2cec504d8b142c396fc
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-api-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/02/327602/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import urlparse import keystoneauth1.identity.v2 as v2 import keystoneauth1.identity.v3 as v3 import keystoneauth1.session as kssession def get_keystone_session(creds): url_parts = urlparse.urlparse(creds['auth_url']) path = url_parts.path.lower() if path.startswith('/v3'): # Use v3 plugin to authenticate auth = v3.Password(auth_url=creds['auth_url'], username=creds['username'], password=creds['password'], project_name=(creds.get('project_name') or creds.get('tenant_name'))) else: # Use v2 plugin auth = v2.Password(auth_url=creds['auth_url'], username=creds['username'], password=creds['password'], tenant_name=creds['tenant_name']) session = kssession.Session(auth=auth) return session

commit_message:
Fix wrong usage of novaclient

novaclient.client.Client is a documented way to initialize novaclient.
Also, it provides a backward compatible layer.

Change-Id: I9dd15abbeda26c5a6a40139ce47a200720decce8
Closes-Bug: #1493576

commit_message:
add sphinx-argparse to global requirements

This library with extention that can be used for creating autogenerated
documention for CLI. Additionally,

1. any new contribution are welcome per contrib page in
   readthedocs [0], by the way there is no commits since middle of
   2015;
2. library have good enough code, which have proof of correct preparing
   autogenerated docs of CLI in python-saharaclient
3. no offical support of python3, but it works at least for
   saharaclient case, and also there is python3 package in
   ubuntu for latest version [2];
4. MIT licensed;
5. Packaged for Ubuntu ([2], [3]). For Fedora case there is a [4]
6. Can used by all openstackclient plugins and openstackclient as well,
   saharaclient is also supposed to be user of this library.

[0] https://sphinx-argparse.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contrib.html
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-saharaclient/cli.html
[2] http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/python3-sphinx-argparse
[3] http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/python-sphinx-argparse
[4] https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-sphinx-argparse

Change-Id: I7cb7e0e33fb3f674003a656652b79ed47ff7b000

commit_message:
initial kerberos integration

spec to describe initial kerberos integration

Change-Id: I9b6f0bc221a6918d45d63769ce9a0e2d7726a140
blueprint: initial-kerberos-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/16/327616/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================ Initial Kerberos Integration ============================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/initial-kerberos-integration There is no way to enable kerberos integration for clusters deployed by Sahara. By the way, default managament services like Cloudera Manager and Ambari Management console already have support of configuring Kerberos for deployed clusters. We should make initial integration of this feature in sahara for Cloudera and Ambari plugins. Problem description =================== Users wants to use Kerberos to make clusters created by Sahara more secure. Proposed change =============== The proposed changes will be the following: * the initial MIT of KDC integration on cluster nodes. Also admin principal will be created for sahara usages (and sahara will store that using improved secret storage); * ability to configure Kerberos on clusters created by using Cloudera Manager API (see the reference below [0], [1], [2]) and Ambari (see the reference below [3]) will be added; * remote operations which are requires auth should be wrapped by ticket granting method so that sahara will be able to perform operations with hdfs and something like that; * Oozie client should be re-implemented to reflect these changes. By default, in case when cluster is not deployed with Kerberos (like vanilla) we will continue using requests python library to bind Oozie API (without needed auth). The new Oozie client should be implemented in case of kerberos implemented. This client will use standard remote implementation and curl in order to process auth to Oozie with ticket granting. As another way, we can use request-kerberos for that goal, but it's not good solution since this lib are not python3 compatible. Other possible improvements can be done after implementation of steps above. By the way, initial implementation will only include steps above. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None. If needed, extra field will be used for that goal. REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vgridnev (Vitaly Gridnev) and msionkin (Michael Ionkin) Work Items ---------- All working items are will described in Proposed change. Additionally, we can include testing initial Kerberos integration on Sahara CI, but only when all steps are completed. For sure, unit tests will be added. Dependencies ============ Depends on OpenStack requirements. As initial idea, nothing additional should not be added to current sahara requirements, all needed packages will be included only on sahara images. Testing ======= Sahara CI will cover that change, unit tests for sure will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== New sections can be added with description of Kerberos integration in Ambari and Cloudera. References ========== [0] https://github.com/cloudera/cm_api/blob/f4431606a690d95208457a64d1cc2610d9cfa2bf/python/src/cm_api/endpoints/cms.py#L134 [1] https://github.com/cloudera/cm_api/blob/f4431606a690d95208457a64d1cc2610d9cfa2bf/python/src/cm_api/endpoints/clusters.py#L585 [2] http://www.cloudera.com/documentation/enterprise/5-5-x/topics/cm_sg_using_cm_sec_config.html [3] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/Automated+Kerberizaton#AutomatedKerberizaton-TheRESTAPI

commit_message:
Skip test suite on 32-bit platforms

There are some known mismatches (1024 vs 1024L) in the testsuite
for 32bit platforms, and since it is not tested upstream either
let's just skip it until it got fixed.

Change-Id: I98dec8990e6aa6940ca48a42cf85f0e0406c0823
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/39/331539/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
devstack: Change MidoNet deb repository URL

Currently http://builds.midonet.org/current provides 5.1.1 rc.
OTOH, http://builds.midonet.org/devstack provides nightly builds of
midonet master. (currently 5.2)
The latter is what's intended to use here.

Closes-Bug: #1594746
Change-Id: I16968ed3945b060bb4daa7675720f5bd9d90ecab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/55/332055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MIDNOET_DEB_URI=${MIDNOET_DEB_URI:-http://builds.midonet.org/devstack}

commit_message:
Add association of the admin user to a domain.

If the user specify target_admin_domain then the admin user will be
admin in this domain.

Change-Id: Ia0661f9ab8807a96d3c7de22de4e4624db9e7f28
Closes-bug: 1589933
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/07/329807/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*target_admin_domain*] # Optional. Domain where the admin user will have the $admin_role # Defaults to undef (undef will not associate the $admin_role to any # domain, only project) # $target_admin_domain = undef, $domains = unique(delete_undef_values([ $admin_user_domain, $admin_project_domain, $service_project_domain, $target_admin_domain])) if $target_admin_domain { keystone_user_role { "${admin}@::${target_admin_domain}": ensure => present, user_domain => $admin_user_domain, roles => $admin_roles, } Keystone_user_role["${admin}@::${target_admin_domain}"] -> File<| tag == 'openrc' |> }

commit_message:
Added a muranoPL-specific override of 'call'

Yaql's standard system function 'call' was not working properly in
MuranoPL because murano relies on object-specific context containing
definitions of the methods of appropriate class.

This patch adds a MuranoPL-specific override of this function which
creates an appropriate method-invocation AST and executes it. This
will invoke regular muranoPl's override of operator_. thus causing all
the appropriate type and object contexts to be created for the call.

Closes-bug: #1595174

Change-Id: If3e98a60063b0843c317fa565616c8d88f9e497c

commit_message:
Update PCI spec to use 'device_id' instead of 'product_id'

The term DEVICE ID is the correct PCI term:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PCI_configuration_space#Standardized_registers

Update the spec to use 'device_id' instead of 'product_id'

Change-Id: I2f2a541561bb785c33f03cedebd5e6aded339a7a

commit_message:
ironic driver: Adding InfiniBand support

This patch normalize the port address from
InfiniBand GUID to MAC

Implements: blueprint ironic-infiniband-support

Change-Id: I0271f99b7e39f690619f10aabbad37380ecb5d5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/266540/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return set([self._normalize_to_mac(p.address) for p in ports]) def _normalize_to_mac(self, address): """Normalize address to MAC convert GID to MAC by taking the lower and upper 3 octets of the GUID. The GUID is part of the GID. :param address: GID or MAC. :returns: truncated MAC. """ if len(address) == 59: return address[36:-14] + address[51:] return address
deleted_lines: return set([p.address for p in ports])

commit_message:
Update dhcp_opts on both create and update

The dhcp_opts come from the virt driver, so longer term will always
happen only in the port update. During this transition, for now we just
make sure we always send the dhcp_opts for both create and update.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

Change-Id: Ib58167152d8fc81f9272f2aca56ce493f72eb43d

commit_message:
WIP - adding OSD level params

This is to address bug 1488126.
The osd parameters added will be disabled by default as to not cause duplicate declarations for
users defining this with in-house puppet modules

Change-Id: I55aecba3e61b1d86b807433b87724758d2d65d90

subject: add a test to demonstrate what happens with a merged tag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 18:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['reno/tests/test_scanner.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/reno/commit/fc9ee4216cb781d0dbd426ad81eafce151a76136', 'message': 'add a test to demonstrate what happens with a merged tag

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096895.html

Change-Id: I9c6511bd9e5528b81aae7c9cd9eba7ebd36174df
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add a test to demonstrate what happens with a merged tag

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096895.html

Change-Id: I9c6511bd9e5528b81aae7c9cd9eba7ebd36174df
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/73/327273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class MergeTagTest(Base): def test_1(self): # Merge a tag from a branch into master, without merging the # contents of the file into master. Reno should skip that tag # when looking at the history. n1 = self._add_notes_file() self._run_git('tag', '-s', '-m', 'first tag', '1.0.0') self._run_git('checkout', '-b', 'test_merge_tags') self._add_notes_file() self._run_git('tag', '-s', '-m', 'second tag', '1.1.0') self._run_git('checkout', 'master') self._add_other_file('ignore-1.txt') # Merge the tag, without any of the file content, into the # master branch. See the merge_tags.sh script in # openstack-infra/project-config/jenkins/scripts for an # example of this in real life. self._run_git('merge', '--strategy', 'ours', '-m', 'merge 1.1.0 tag into master', '1.1.0') print(self._run_git('show', '--pretty=full')) self._add_other_file('ignore-2.txt') n3 = self._add_notes_file() print('pre tag describe:', self._run_git('describe')) self._run_git('tag', '-s', '-m', 'third tag', '2.0.0') print(self._run_git('log', '--oneline', '--graph', '--decorate')) raw_results = scanner.get_notes_by_version( self.reporoot, 'releasenotes/notes', ) results = { k: [f for (f, n) in v] for (k, v) in raw_results.items() } self.assertEqual( {'1.0.0': [n1], '2.0.0': [n3]}, results, ) self.assertEqual( ['2.0.0', '1.0.0'], list(raw_results.keys()), )

commit_message:
Add Zaqar password to deployment

In order to deploy with the new Zaqar composable role, a password
must be generated and passed on deployment.

Change-Id: Ia863b38bbac1aceabe6b7deb6939c9db693ff16d
Depends-On: Icdc4a9af35e900594f0e8f9ed141fc9959daa179
Implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/50/330650/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters['ZaqarPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_ZAQAR_PASSWORD']

subject: Make dib_cache dir with sudo in dib jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/diskimage-builder.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/c937f975953ee45dacd55a14e6712f4300e692c1', 'message': 'Make dib_cache dir with sudo in dib jobs

We forgot to make this dir as sudo so we fail with permission denied.

Change-Id: Ifbeb5eea8ed72194d86b3bc3b693f7d1c9b592de
'}]
commit_message:
Make dib_cache dir with sudo in dib jobs

We forgot to make this dir as sudo so we fail with permission denied.

Change-Id: Ifbeb5eea8ed72194d86b3bc3b693f7d1c9b592de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/333415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo mkdir /opt/dib_cache sudo chown jenkins:jenkins /opt/dib_cache

commit_message:
Add install-{obs, rdo, ubuntu}.rst files

Add install-obs.rst, install-rdo.rst and install-ubuntu.rst
for distro installations beacause the doc infrastructure is
not set up to support conditional content.

Factor out database setup, creation of service, creation of
endpoints and service configuration.

Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguides
Change-Id: I064181f512961516c7c50844d04f1ad27eda928d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter refs/changes/61/332161/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: environment with at least the following components installed: (add the appropriate services here and further notes) Note that installation and configuration vary by distribution. .. toctree:: install-obs.rst install-rdo.rst install-ubuntu.rst
deleted_lines: environment with at least the Identity service, the Compute service, and the Image service installed. Prerequisites ------------- Before you install and configure the {{cookiecutter.service}} service, you must create a database, service credentials, and API endpoints. #. To create the database, complete these steps: * Use the database access client to connect to the database server as the ``root`` user: .. code-block:: console $ mysql -u root -p * Create the ``{{cookiecutter.codename}}`` database: .. code-block:: mysql CREATE DATABASE {{cookiecutter.codename}}; * Grant proper access to the ``{{cookiecutter.codename}}`` database: .. code-block:: mysql GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON {{cookiecutter.codename}}.* TO '{{cookiecutter.codename}}'@'localhost' \ IDENTIFIED BY '{{cookiecutter.codename|upper}}_DBPASS'; GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON {{cookiecutter.codename}}.* TO '{{cookiecutter.codename}}'@'%' \ IDENTIFIED BY '{{cookiecutter.codename|upper}}_DBPASS'; Replace ``{{cookiecutter.codename|upper}}_DBPASS`` with a suitable password. * Exit the database access client. .. code-block:: mysql exit; #. Source the ``admin`` credentials to gain access to admin-only CLI commands: .. code-block:: console $ source admin-openrc #. To create the service credentials, complete these steps: * Create the ``{{cookiecutter.codename}}`` user: .. code-block:: console $ openstack user create --domain default --password-prompt {{cookiecutter.codename}} * Add the ``admin`` role to the ``{{cookiecutter.codename}}`` user: .. code-block:: console $ openstack role add --project service --user {{cookiecutter.codename}} admin * Create the {{cookiecutter.codename}} service entities: .. code-block:: console $ openstack service create --name {{cookiecutter.codename}} --description "{{cookiecutter.service}}" {{cookiecutter.service|lower}} #. Create the {{cookiecutter.service}} service API endpoints: .. code-block:: console $ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ {{cookiecutter.service|lower}} public http://controller:XXXX/vY/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ {{cookiecutter.service|lower}} internal http://controller:XXXX/vY/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ {{cookiecutter.service|lower}} admin http://controller:XXXX/vY/%\(tenant_id\)s Install and configure components -------------------------------- Finalize installation ---------------------

commit_message:
Inherit custom yaml Loader from yaml.SafeLoader

Before this patch yaql-enabled yaml Loader was inherited from yaml.Loader, that
potentially allows creating arbitrary python objects from specifically
formatted yaml tags. This could have happened whenever UI definitions of
the package were processed.
With this change yaql yaml-Loader no longer allows creating custom python objects.

Change-Id: I4fe38aa7e0fc567211ab872c7e1f8e81dbc3e765
Closes-Bug: #1586079
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/32/333432/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- security: - cve-2016-4972 has been addressed. In ceveral places Murano used loaders inherited directly from yaml.Loader when parsing MuranoPL and UI files from packages. This is unsafe, because this loader is capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed yaml files. With this change all yaml loading operations are done using safe loaders instead.

commit_message:
Integrate normalize as part of the requirements tools

Rather than have this as an external tool that open codes some of the logic
we have in the existing codebase we should integrate it.

Change-Id: I979dcefeec4ae28705088d4fac1e41b4d33e40e0

commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the client to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsfae do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
UI parsing functions also fell back to yaml.Loader if
the custom loader was not supplied.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.

Change-Id: Id9bb6eabda35522271ec394f8758a974878cbb4b
Closes-Bug: #1586078
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/44/333444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- security: - cve-2016-4972 has been addressed. In ceveral places Murano used loaders inherited directly from yaml.Loader when parsing MuranoPL and UI files from packages. This is unsafe, because this loader is capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed yaml files. With this change all yaml loading operations are done using safe loaders instead.

commit_message:
Correct domain_id and name constraint dropping

The 'domain_id' and 'name' unique constraint was not properly dropped
in some cases because the unique constraint was not consistently
named. In all cases we must search for the constraint expected,
not assume the name of the constraint will be consistent
(especially from older installs that have been moved forward in
releases). This fix is modeled on the fix for a similair issue
authored by Morgan Fainberg & Matthew Thode for Bug #1562934

Migration 091:
    Fix to broken migration to prevent failed migrations when database is
    upgraded from Kilo (or below) to Mitaka
Migration 097:
    Ensure that when Mitaka point release is applied the constraint and tables
    have been dropped if migration 91 was previously worked around.

Migration 91 drops 3 columns from the user table after the code to disable
the constraint. I have included code in migrations 97 to also drop
those columns if they are still present in case they were missed when working
around Bug #1572341. This may be over kill.

The following file conflicted since Opportunistic DB testing was included
in the Newton release.

  keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py

Note that migration 104 was removed since it does not exist in the Mitaka
release. The unit tests were also modified accordingly.

Change-Id: I076d7139b388e30be8826d0a4550256b5617d992
Closes-bug: #1572341

commit_message:
Add ironic mac address when updating and creating

We should ensure we add a mac_address from the pool of available
addresses (for ironic) both when the user has already created a port and
when Nova is creating a port for the user.

This patch includes catching the MacAddressInUseClient exception when
updating a port that has possibly updated the mac. This is to match the
behavior when we call create_port.

The data for  mac addresses comes from the virt driver, so eventually
this will only happen during port update. As a first step we move it to
be called during both create and update paths.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import yaml import jsonschema from fuelweb_test.helpers import metaclasses import system_test # from system_test.core.discover import load_yaml class ConfigValidator(object): __metaclass__ = metaclasses.SingletonMeta def __init__(self): self.schema = self.load_schema() def load_schema(self): """Loads validation schema for test config""" path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(system_test.__file__), 'helpers/cluster_template_schema.yaml') with open(path) as f: return yaml.load(f) def validate(self, config): jsonschema.validate(config, self.schema) def validate(config): ConfigValidator().validate(config)

commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the client to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsfae do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
UI parsing functions also fell back to yaml.Loader if
the custom loader was not supplied.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.

Change-Id: Id9bb6eabda35522271ec394f8758a974878cbb4b
Closes-Bug: #1586078
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/43/333443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: loader_cls = yaml.SafeLoader

commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.Loader

Before this patch yaml.Loader was used by the client to create custom
yaql-enabled yaml loader. It is unsfae do to so, because yaml.Loader is
capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed
yaml files.
UI parsing functions also fell back to yaml.Loader if
the custom loader was not supplied.
After this patch all yaml load operations are performed with safe
loaders instead.

commit_message:
Remove network-id from tap-service

Currently it's unused.  Thus no good reason to force users to
specify it.

It can be re-introduced when/if we decide automatic port creation
is desirable.  For db models, a boolean to say if the port has been
automatically created might be more appropriate, though.

Change-Id: Ia183635c183fd4ad731fd1ee48c58f6b10f06c5b

commit_message:
Fix dropdowns sometimes not opening in integration tests

Since most probable cause of dropdowns not opening intermittently is
Bootstrap initialization code not having enough time to complete
before test tries to open dropdown, make test wait a specified timeout
before clicking it (by means of setting a CSS class after that
timeout, which test in turn waits before clicking the dropdown).

Closes-Bug: #1594926
Change-Id: I32625caa4433f4af0de72c94b61e85ab4e16b1f9

commit_message:
Inherit custom yaml Loader from yaml.SafeLoader

Before this patch yaql-enabled yaml Loader was inherited from yaml.Loader, that
potentially allows creating arbitrary python objects from specifically
formatted yaml tags. This could have happened whenever UI definitions of
the package were processed.
With this change yaql yaml-Loader no longer allows creating custom python objects.

Change-Id: I4fe38aa7e0fc567211ab872c7e1f8e81dbc3e765
Closes-Bug: #1586079
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/39/333439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- security: - cve-2016-4972 has been addressed. In ceveral places Murano used loaders inherited directly from yaml.Loader when parsing MuranoPL and UI files from packages. This is unsafe, because this loader is capable of creating custom python objects from specifically constructed yaml files. With this change all yaml loading operations are done using safe loaders instead.

commit_message:
Follow symlinks when copying logs

There are symlinks in /etc/openvswitch, these cause failing log uploads
because the target will be unreadable.

Change-Id: I0c07b41161aa47e518d343196242e339fdf2281d
